definition: A memory encoding process that stores the meaning, concepts, and relationships of information, abstracted away from specific episodes.

positive_examples: Over time she learned the general concept of reinforcement learning, not just specific examples.
The agent compressed many conversations into abstract rules about user preferences.
He remembered that Paris is the capital of France, without recalling when he learned it.
negative_examples: I remember that particular night we debugged the outage.
The system kept a raw transcript of the meeting.
She could recall the exact words he used, but not the underlying idea.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not episodic details; specifically encoding abstracted meanings, concepts, and facts.
